Name: EnLiSense
ProjectName: SWEATSENSER Dx Development
Description: Real-time, simultaneous testing of multiple biomarkers in passive eccrine sweat. The overall objective of this contract is to advance the development of EnLiSense√ïs Wearable Point-of-Need SWEATSENSER Dx. SWEATSENSER Dx rapidly detects and continuously tracks multiple biomarkers in a multiplexed manner towards tracking wellness to illness and recovery states of users.
Disruption: DRIVe is partnering with EnLiSense to develop tools to empower individuals with critical information about their health status. This is part of ENACT's goal to disrupt healthcare by bringing diagnostics out of healthcare settings, enabling early information to individuals to take action to protect their health, and the health of those in their community.

Name: Spire Health
ProjectName: Spire Health Tags
Description: The overall objective of this project is to deliver 150 sets (8 tags per set) of Spire Health Tags for use in DRIVe Influenza study and accompanying data. The devices are wear and forget health tracker that invisibly monitors respiration, heart rate, sleep, and other markers.
Disruption: Most trackers miss certain time periods throughout the day, but these washable Health Tags stick to your clothes letting you monitor your health nearly 24/7.

Name: InnaMed
ProjectName: Development of Sepsis Biomarker Detection Assay
Description: Optimization and Validation of an electrochemical proximity assay to detect a sepsis biomarker.
Disruption: InnaMed is using a recently identified sepsis biomarker with the potential to facilitate early, accurate sepsis diagnosis and stratify sepsis severity for individualized treatment. InnaMed is using their novel technology to develop an inexpensive, easy to use, point of care device for use in both hospital and community settings.

Name: Prenosis
ProjectName: Sepsis Biomarker Assays to Build Prenosis Immunix Software
Description: Validation of sepsis biomarker assays with the potential to incorporate into a point of care device
Disruption: Prenosis is changing the landscape of sepsis diagnosis. Validation of their unique set of sepsis biomarkers brings us one step closer to a rapid, comprehensive point of care device poised to deliver accurate sepsis prediction, early diagnosis, and informed individualized treatment.

Name: Cytovale
ProjectName: SeptiScan Beta Evaluation Study
Description: Novel microfluidic device to measure biophysical changes in immune cells from blood samples
Disruption: Early, accurate diagnosis of sepsis will save lives. Cytovale's IntelliSep system is inexpensive, easy to use, and delivers results in less than 10 minutes.

Name: Biobeat
Stage: TRL 8 - Pivotal Clinical Studies and Regulatory Approval

The use of a wearable device to continuously capture clinical endpoints can lead to better technologies alert users prior to symptom onset.

ProjectName: Multicenter Deployment and Evaluation of COMPOSER on FHIR
ProductName:
Conformal Multidimensional Prediction of Sepsis Risk
(COMPOSER)

Emory is developing a machine learning algorithm with a goal to  achieve FDA clearance as software as a medical device to predict sepsis that, once integrated into hospital ICU systems, would allow for earlier intervention by physicians.

Name: Sepsis Alliance
ProjectName: Development of Sepsis Institute

Name: Immunexpress
Stage: TRL 8 - Pivotal Clinical Studies and Regulatory Approval
ProjectName: Near-Patient Sepsis Diagnosis Using SeptiCyte Technology
Description: Development of condensed biomarker panel for diagnosis of sepsis
Disruption: The SeptiCyte diagnostic may have the ability to distinguish between sepsis and other inflammatory conditions, giving a definitive sepsis diagnosis hours before clinical signs, saving lives by allowing early treatment.

Name: Empatica
ProjectName: Presymptomatic Influenza Detection
Description: Use physiological parameters captured by Empatica's smartband to potentially predict illness using enhanced machine learning
Disruption: The Embrace2 utilizes multiple physiological parameters to rapidly detect patterns that could predict respiratory infections and exposures to pathogens before signs of illness are apparent and alert users and caregivers.

Name: Qvella
ProjectName:
Sepsis Diagnosis Using Qvella√Ø¬ø¬Ωs
FAST-HR Host-Response-Based Assay System
Description: Expansion of FAST-ID platform to include host biomarkers for diagnosis of sepsis and infection

Name: Enesi Pharma
ProjectName: Evaluation of Novel Solid Dose Vaccines for Use in a Future Pandemic Influenza
Description: Analytical and pre-clinical evaluation of novel ImplaVax-enabled solid dose implant formulations of marketed influenza vaccines in validated models
Disruption: Through simple but robust needle-free vaccine delivery system, ImplaVax has the potential to become a cost-effective innovation that could improve influenza vaccination update, coverage, and compliance, and provide unsurpassed health security in the face of seasonal or pandemic influenza outbreaks.

Name: Janus-I Sciences
ProjectName: Direct RNA Sequencing of Emerging Respiratory Agents and Host Response
ProductName: Diagnostic Assay using Direct RNA Sequencing
Description: Development of a simple nanopore sequencing-based platform that can identify unknown viruses in clinical specimen and detect host responses, enabling identification of the causative agent of a viral infection and providing host response information without having any preconceived notions about the virus(es) involved.
Disruption: This project has the potential to revolutionize diagnostic testing by enabling a truly agnostic prognostic diagnostic, based on nanopore sequencing technologies, to be integrated into patient-care settings, informing caregivers to begin appropriate treatement and intervention at the earliest possible time point, saving lives and reducing morbidity.

Name: Biobeat
ProjectName: Using the Biobeat monitoring device to monitor subjects during a Influenza Vaccine Human Challenge study
Description: The use of a wearable device to continuously capture clinical endpoints can lead to better technologies alert users prior to symptom onset. This project will support a BARDA novel Flu vaccine clinical study with Biobeat monitoring devices; provision of hardware and software allowed for data transmission and storage; training of site personnel and related translation services; data analysis; and software enhancements.√ì
Disruption: By leveraging the Biobeat wearable device in an Influenza Vaccine Human Challenge study, DRIVe aims to overcome significant challenges associated with patient reported outcomes as well as collect key health signatures in the earliest stages of disease.

Name: Evidation Health
ProjectName: Novel Respiratory Virus Detection & Forecasting Model
Description: Leverage the Evidation research platform utilizing patient-generated health to improve infectious disease prediction and enhance capabilities to detect respiratory infections prior to the onset of symptoms
Disruption: This technology has the potential to enable Americans to monitor their respiratory disease symptoms and take precautions against spreading such diseases - days before symptoms appear

Name: University of California San Diego
ProjectName: In-Vivo Vagus Sentinels to Detect and Prevent Infection
Description: Non-invasive, continuous monitoring of host-response through measurements of vagus nerve firing patterns can lead to development of novel diagnostic monitoring systems on the user or in the home.
Disruption: In the near future, this technology will provide Americans continuous monitoring to alert them of potential exposures to pathogens. This allows interventions against progression of disease potentially days before symptoms appear.

Name: Inflammatix, Inc
ProjectName: Clinical Validation and Implementation of HostDx Sepsis on Nanostring
Description: Diagnostic that can determine the presence and type of acute infection or sepsis (bacterial vs. viral vs. non-infected) as well as prognosticate outcome.
Disruption: When an infection progresses to sepsis, that infection becomes life threatening. Having a diagnostic that both identifies type of infection and determines the likelihood of mortality will facilitate appropriate clinical management.

Name: Sonica Health
ProjectName: Advanced, Bio-Integrated, and Cloud-Enabled Sensors for Early Diagnosis of Respiratory Infections in the Home Setting
Description: Sonica's ADAM system comprises a soft, comfortable and continuous bio-integrated wireless sensor that couples intimately to the skin in unique locations of anatomical performance. This project will examine user compliance, and establish ADAM's ability to identify early respiratory infections in a high-risk clinical population.
Disruption: Potential to provide a full suite of respiratory digital biomarkers and ability to predict impending respiratory infection, warn of continued infectiousness, and identify treatment non-responders.

Name: Sound Life Sciences
ProjectName: Detection of Incipient Respiratory Infections using Smart Speaker Sonar
ProductName: Sound Life Sciences software monitoring system
Description: Sound Life Sciences' sonar enabled smart speaker can monitor individuals breathing rate and morphology within the comforts of their home with the potential for early identification of acute respiratory infection.
Disruption: This technology promotes a rapid, noninvasive detection modality for respiratory infections, thereby improving social distancing and reducing the spread of illness caused by in-person medical, lab & pharmaceutical care.

Name: 98point6
ProjectName: Comprehensive Infectious Disease Interdiction
Description: This service pairs AI/machine learning with board-certified physicians to meet patients nationwide wherever they are via their smartphone. This technology empowers Americans by providing on-demand virtual care to treat infectious diseases.
Disruption: This technology promotes more rapid detection and treatment, thereby improving social distancing and reducing the spread of illness caused by in-person medical, lab & pharmaceutical care.

Name: END SEPSIS
ProjectName: Maternal Sepsis
Description: Identify and analyze the risk factors associated with maternal sepsis in order to educate providers, patients, policymakers and other key stakeholders about the condition through the development of audience-specific educational materials and tools.
Disruption: As one of the leading causes of pregnancy-related deaths in the US, this partnership will increase understanding of the risk factors associated with maternal sepsis, increase public awareness and empower health care providers and patients to improve health outcomes.

Name: Beckman Coulter
ProjectName: Monocyte Distribution Width and Predictive Analytic Algorithms for Sepsis Detection
Description: A sepsis diagnostic integrating EHR data with novel laboratory test parameters
Disruption: A next generation algorithm that combines EHR data with laboratory test parameters will be able to rapidly test and predict sepsis earlier.  This is critical for early intervention with sepsis patients to save lives.

Name: Cytovale
ProjectName: Septiscan Product Development
Description: Advance development towards FDA clearance of a sepsis diagnostic designed to measure immune cell activity associated with the host immune response to sepsis.
Disruption: Cytovale's system leverages the latest technology in microfluidics, high speed imaging, and machine learning to detect sepsis-specific biophysical signatures of immune cells. A sepsis diagnostic with results in under 10 minutes will facilitate rapid, life-saving intervention for sepsis.

Name: General Electric Research
ProjectName: Ultrasound Stimulated Immune Response Profiles (StimResponse): New Tool for Pre-symptomatic Pathogen Exposure Detection
Description: Continue to advance prior US Government development of GE ultrasound neuromodulation technology as a diagnostic test. The overall objective of this project is to develop a pre-symptomatic diagnostic of pathogen exposure (called StimResponse) that eliminates the need for multi-day tests by using a single 0.5 √ê3.0-hour test that detects pathogen specific signatures to a non-invasion ultrasound neuroimmune stimulation.
Disruption: Potential to detect pre-symptomatic exposure to respiratory pathogens and pneumonia using ultrasound.  GE's ultrasound neuromodulation technology involves using an ultrasound stimulus to activate a neuroimmune pathway, such that the response to the stimulus provides a more rapid assessment of exposure.

Name: Rizlab Health
ProjectName: A Data-Driven Home Monitoring System for Classifying Viral/Bacterial Infections
Description: The CytoTracker is a pocket-size device that can perform complete blood counts (CBCs) from a drop of blood to help inform disease diagnosis for a number of illnesses such as infectious disease, cancer, and various autoimmune diseases.  The  objective of this project is to develop a working prototype of a home based mobile health monitoring system for assessing whether users exhibiting cold symptoms are likely experiencing a bacterial or viral infection.
Disruption: The Rizlab CytoTracker will enable patients suffering from cold symptoms to be assessed for the likelihood of a viral or bacterial infection.  Once this system is developed, it will help clinicians assess patients in their care at their homes to determine the appropriateness of antibiotic use by differentiating those suffering from a viral infection from those infected with bacteria.

Name: Stanford Medicine
ProjectName: Lab on a Dust System (LDS)
Description: LDS is a revolutionary, fully integrated, mm scale molecular diagnostic system based on a disposable silicon chip. The overall objective of this project is to develop a fully integrated molecular diagnostic system on a miniaturized, disposable CMOS chip. The project includes simultaneous detection of three biomarkers of inflammation (C-reactive protein, TNF-alpha, and IL-1 RA) in a finger-prick blood. After detecting the biomarkers, the CMOS chip will wirelessly transmit the chemical information to an external smart phone with a custom developed app.
Disruption: The millimeter sized system can be immersed in a clinical sample, simultaneously measure multiple protein biomarkers, and wirelessly transmit results (no sample prep, instrumentation, or reagents required), thus achieving a truly "distributed" molecular diagnostics in a miniaturized and low-cost manner.

Name: Stanford Medicine
ProjectName: Minimally Invasive Monitoring of Stress State Feasibility Demo
ProductName: Minimally Invasive Monitoring of Stress State
Description:
Advance development towards continuous monitoring of host response markers such as cytokines to indicate presymptomatic exposures to pathogens via Stanford's smart patch sensor.
The overall objective of this contract is to develop the first molecular diagnostic device that can continuously measure multiple biomarkers in the interstitial space (interstitium). The data from this sensor will enable better understanding of the physiological state and allow for earlier detection and prevention of a wide range of undesired health conditions. As a model, the continuous measurement of glucose and cortisol will be demonstrated. Furthermore,  feasibility for measuring low-abundance protein biomarkers of inflammation including c-reactive protein (CRP) and interleukin-1 beta (IL-1b) will be tested.
Disruption: Stanford's technology leverages the latest technology in sensors, wearable technology and microfluidics to detect biochemical markers in interstitial fluid. The patch is expected to last approximately 2 weeks and allow individuals to monitor their own health at home, on the go, etc. and receive a warning of a potential infection days prior to symptom onset.

Name: Empatica
ProjectName: EMPACT: Early Monitoring Platform Against COVID-19 Transmission
Description: Aura is an early warning platform for COVID-19 infection. This diagnostics platform enables continuous and real-time insight into infection likelihood before symptoms present, through the use of a wearable device and an algorithm that can continuously monitor physiological health markers and produce an output.
Disruption: Individuals infected with SARS-CoV-2 and similar viruses usually seek diagnostic tests once they begin exhibiting symptoms, often after an infected person is contagious. Empatica aims to prevent spread by detecting infection in individuals before the onset of symptoms, allowing early intervention through self-quarantine, treatment, and care.

Name: Evidation Health
ProjectName: Detection & Forecasting Model Pilot
Description: Evidation seeks to develop a model that can detect whether an individual has likely been infected with COVID-19 and understand an individual's susceptibility to infection. This project builds on Evidation's current partnership with BARDA to monitor individuals for respiratory infections, such as influenza. This pilot study will demonstrate utility of empowering Americans with a novel means to self-monitor to improve health outcomes for COVID-19. The study will initiate with healthcare workers and first responders, who are our nation's, front-line responders, to more readily be diagnosed to prevent exposure to others. The study has the potential for large-scale deployment to allow Americans to determine risk of COVID-19 and to appropriately implement precautions against spread of COVID-19 and other such diseases.
Disruption: This effort will track the infection of COVID-19 in high risk individuals and healthcare workers in order to develop an early warning algorithm for symptoms of COVID-19 as well as conduct a pilot study for a large-scale COVID19 sentinel network in the US.

Name: 98point6
ProjectName: Text-Based Medical Care via a Smartphone Interface and Artificial Intelligence to Assess, Triage, Diagnose and Treat COVID-19
Description: The 98point6 primary care platform combines a telehealth service with AI and machine learning to provide a comprehensive program of diagnosis, assessment, triage, reporting and tracking of SARS-CoV-2 infections to a national population of patients. 98point6 will develop and deploy a comprehensive program of COVID-19 interdictions. As treatment and vaccination options become available, 98point6 will build targeted workflows to encourage effective interventions based on demographics, risk factors and other data. 98point6 will provide patients with relevant information on reducing disease transmission and monitor patient health via follow-ups.
Disruption: The ability to assess data daily across a national population allows real-time comparison of geographic patterns of infection. By combining ease of access and little to no cost per visit, 98point6 encourages patients to seek care at the earliest stages of illness.

Name: Experovax
ProjectName: Development of mRNA oral cellular vaccine delivery technology
Description: An oral immunization for COVID-19 involving delivery of enveloped virus like particles (eVLPs) by capsule to the gut that will induce immune protection against disease.
Disruption: This technology aims to provide a cost-effective technological innovation that improves immunization uptake, coverage, compliance and preparedness, with the potential for self-administration

Name: Vaxess Technologies Inc
ProjectName: MIMIX-COVID Development of a home-based, shelf-stable, self-applied, single-dose vaccine-delivery microneedle array skin patch
Description: MIMIX Vaccine Patch Development and manufacturing scaling of shelf-stable, self-applied, single-dose single-dose Micro Array Patch (MAP) technology
Disruption: This technology could open the profound potential for large-scale distribution of self-administered immunizations that rival or potentially surpass the effectiveness of an immunization delivered via traditional needle and syringe.

Name: Verndari, Inc.
ProjectName: Recombinant Spike RBD Skin Protein Administered via Micro Array Patch
Description: SARS-CoV-2 Recombinant Spike Receptor Binding Domain protein administered via Micro Array Patch (MAP) Technology
Disruption: This technology aims to provide a cost-effective technological innovation that improves immunization uptake, coverage, compliance and preparedness, with the potential for self-administration.

Name: MIT Lincoln Laboratory
ProjectName: Physiologic Signals Data Repository and AI Platform
ProductName: Physiologic Signals Data Repository and AI Platform
Description: The goal of this project is to develop a Physiological Signals Data Repository and AI platform (PSM Data/AI Platform) coupled with advanced data analytics and algorithms to provide insight into presymptomatic changes and predict outcomes.
Disruption: This effort will leverage MIT Linclon Laboratory expertise in big data, data architectures, signal processing, biomedical informatics and AI to accelerate the discovery and use of physiological markers for early detection and diagnosis of clinical phenotypes arising from biological and chemical exposures. The outcomes of this study will enhance our knowledge of physiological changes that may serve as presymptomatic indicators of communicable infections like COVID-19 or influenza.

Name: MIT Langer Lab
ProjectName: 3D Vaccine Printer
Description: Capability development for on demand vaccine production with a continuous, automated (free of user intervention) printing process for the manufacture of vaccine-filled microneedle patches. This include desinging and developing the printer, optimizing process and materials, and demonstrating printed microneedles, as well as loading an mRNA vaccine into microneedles and testing for reproducibility.
Disruption: This technology is will support the development of distributed manufacturing capabilities that will enable the production of microneedle patches at the point-of-service.

Name: University of Connecticut
ProjectName: Single-Administration Microneedle skin patch for Novel Vaccination Technology
Description: An easy-to-use vaccine-delivery microneedle (MN) patch (i.e., Micro Array Patch) that will contain the spike protein (the S-protein on the shell of COVID-19 virus) and be programmed to automatically deliver this S-protein (as an antigen against COVID-19) into the skin.
Disruption: This technology has the potential for mass distribution of self-administered immunizations that rival or potentially surpass the effectiveness of an immunization delivered via traditional needle and syringe.

Name: AgileMD
ProjectName: A Rapid Diagnostic of Risk in COVID-19 Patients to Improve Outcomes and Critical Resource Allocation Using Machine Learning
Description: eCART is a clinical decision support software tool that combines real-time, machine learning-based COVID-19 health deterioration and treatment algorithms with electronic health record data to rapidly identify COVID-19 patients in need of mechanical ventilation or hemodynamic support.
Disruption: Rapid identification of vulnerable patients will permit earlier intervention, saving lives and hospital resources.

Name: Dascena
ProjectName: Rapid development of an accessible mechine learning software for COVID-19 severity predictions
Description: COViage is a clinical decision support software tool that integrates clinical data to inform on patient care, especially COVID-19 patients in need of mechanical ventilation or hemodynamic support.
Disruption: Reduce severity of COVID-19 for hospitalized patients.

Name: FirstString Research, Inc.
ProjectName: aCT1 eye drops to treat ocular injury induced by a vesicant agent
Description: Evaluate the efficacy of aCT1 eye drops in (1) mitigating acute corneal injuries and promoting healing following ocular exposure to the vesicating agent sulfur mustard, and (2) ameliorating the development and severity of long-term symptoms of ocular SM exposure, termed mustard gas keratopathy
Disruption: There are no FDA-approved medical countermeasures for the treatment of mustard gas keratopathy. Based on its pharmacological profile, FirstString’s aCT1 is a therapeutic that demonstrates potential as a unique MCM in promoting corneal wound healing and preventing the onset of serious adverse health effects, such as blindness, following exposure to sulfur mustard.

Name: PeraHealth
ProjectName: COVID-19 Risk Triage Tool
Description: PeraHealth will develop machine learning powered mobile and desktop applications to rapidly assess COVID-19 and non-COVID-19 patient risk for deterioration or mortality, as they enter the emergency department. PeraHealth will demonstrate an ability to implement these tools based on user feedback and scale their deployment in U.S. hospitals during the pandemic. Non-COVID-19 triage tools will also be developed for continued use as the pandemic wanes.
Disruption: The Rothman Index Risk Triage Tool will rapidly assess patient risk for deterioration or mortality in order to aid hospital admission triage and improve clinical management and allocation of resources. This effort will explore the end-user feedback from implementation and demonstrate scaling readiness. In addition, a version of the app will be developed as a non-COVID-19 triage tool for continued impact.

Name: Enalare Therapeutics Inc.
ProjectName: ENA-001 to treat respiratory depression
Description: To reformulate the drug ENA-001 for intramuscular (IM) administration for respiratory depresion. The scope of work for this contract includes formulation development for an IM formulation with the goal of achieving robust stability and storage at room temperature for 18-24 months, commercial manufacturing scalability and fast onset of action. Toxicological and safety studies will be studied using the evaluation of plasma studies in rats and minipigs for the IM route compared to the IV route.
Disruption: The drug overdose epidemic affects millions each year and continues to escalate. Current treatment options for respiratory depression are often inadequate with limited efficacy against multiple agents. A new approach that is agnostic to the cause of respiratory depression is needed. ENA-001 represents a first-in-class respiratory stimulant drug that can reverse opioid-induced respiratory depression using a novel mechanism of action. Reformulating ENA-001 as an intramuscular drug will enable its use as medical countermeasure to treat life-threatening respiratory depression.

Name: Vital Connect, Inc.
ProjectName: R&D of system and algorithm optimization for patient population
Description: Vista Solution is an FDA cleared remote patient monitoring system for use within hospital, nursing home facilities, and homes.  Vista Solution is comprised of the VitalPatch biosensor, a tablet where vital signs are viewed and transmitted to a central cloud, a secure cloud, and a central monitoring hub.
Disruption: Vista Solution is used to monitor and care for patients with COVID-19 as well as at-risk nursing home patients to provide an early indication of patient deterioration prior to a patient becoming clinically symptomatic. Changes in heart rate, respiratory rate, blood oxygen saturation, and QT interval changes will be monitored.

Name: Medicinova
ProjectName: Ibudilast (MN-166) for Chemical Threats
Description: Conduct preliminary proof-of-concept studies with ibudilast in chlorine-induced pulmonary injuriy murine models and to determine the safety and pharmacological activity of intravenous MN-166 following acute lung injury-induced by chlorine inhalation in sheep.
Disruption: There are no specific antidotes for chlorine gas-induced lung injuries. Successful repurposing of MediciNova's Ibudilast (MN-166) as a medical countermeasure for chlorine gas-induced acute respiratory distress and acute lung injury could save lives and improve the quality of life of survivors. If successfull, it would also represent the first approved MCM under the FDA animal rule for this indication.

Name: Beckman Coulter
Stage: TRL 8 - Pivotal Clinical Studies and Regulatory Approval
ProjectName: Monocyte Distribution Width (MDW) for rapid detection of MIS-C associated with COVID-19 in pediatric patients
Description: Beckman Coulter seeks to validate its existing FDA cleared Monocyte Distribution Width (MDW) hematology-based biomarker, currently used to detect adult sepsis,for rapid detection of MIS-C, a severe COVID-19 complication in children.
Disruption: The detection of MIS-C is complex and time-consuming. Current laboratory tests are non-specific, and no MIS-C diagnostic assay exists. This work will support validation of MDW to detect MIS-C, a COVID-19 complication in children by expanding the indication of a FDA cleared sepsis detection biomarker.

Name: Current Health
Stage: TRL 8 - Pivotal Clinical Studies and Regulatory Approval
ProjectName: Real Time Digital Biomarker Algorithms to enable early detection amd improved management of SARS-COV-2/COVID-19 infection
ProductName: Continuous Monitoring Platform & Algorithm for COVID-19 Severity
Description: A FDA-cleared Artificial Intelligence-powered continuous remote patient monitoring platform that utilizes a wearable vital-signs sensor, integrates with other devices and includes symptom chatbot and video visit functionality. The platform continuously collects respiratory rate, oxygen saturation, mobility, pulse rate and body temperature data.
Disruption: Current Health’s platform gives healthcare providers the ability to monitor and manage their patients’ health. Through the establishment of digital biomarker-based algorithms to monitor COVID-19 patients, the platform is expected to detect deterioration of health and predict disease severity to include the need for hospitalization and ICU-level support.

Name: BioAegis
ProjectName: Recombinant human plasma gelsolin, a host-based pathogen agnostic therapeutic for severe infection and sepsis
Description: Recombinant human plasma gelsolin (Rhu-pGSN) protein is a key mediator of innate immunity. Rhu-pGSN supplementation in critically ill patients is expected to resolve inflammation and reduce the dysfunctional host response to infection without suppressing immune function.
Disruption: The recombinant protein therapy, Rhu-pGSN, has the potential to mitigate severe outcomes in patients with severe responses to infection or sepsis of any etiology. The technology has the potential to restore immune balance and improve treatment outcomes as no host-targeted sepsis therapeutic products exist.

Name: US Biologic
ProjectName: Development of a rapid-response oral influenza vaccine
Description: Pre-clinical evaluation of orally administered vaccine for seasonal influenza
Disruption: Satisfies pandemic vaccine TPP characteristics of ease of administration, flexible, and thermostable
